intro: Masdevallia hercules, commonly known as the Hercules masdevallia, is a striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and its showy, dark red flowers with prominent yellow lips. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree trunks in its natural habitat. It prefers cool, humid conditions with high light exposure but requires careful watering to avoid root rot. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts.
